Carlos Gimenez slashed his own salary fr: 230,000 to $150,000 when he first took office as Miami-Dade mayor in 2011.
After seven years: the county commission agreed to raise Gimenez's pay to $250,000 at his request, which was a 67% increase.
Gimenez had a car allowance for a Merced: Benz when he was a county commissioner, but he personally took over the lease when he became mayor.
The claim that Gimenez kept his taxpayer: funded Mercedes-Benz after slashing $400 million in government jobs and spending is misleading, as the car allowance was from about a decade ago and not during his tenure as mayor.
